name: 王正豪
objective:
This course is a graduate-level course for advanced big data analytics and applications. The major topics include: the concepts and principles of big data analytics, frameworks of distributed computing, and applications including: Link Analysis, Social Network Graph Mining, and Recommender Systems. 
In addition to conceptual introduction, with intensive programming exercises in parallel programming and term project, students are expected to learn the big data analytics tools, and to design programs in real big data applications.
schedule:
Part I: Big Data Analytics concepts & Distributed processing (8 wks)
1. Introduction to big data concepts (1 wk)
2. Introduction to distributed platforms: Hadoop & Spark  (1 wk)
3. MapReduce programming: design patterns (pairs & stripes), language model (1 wk)
4. Demo: big data analytics using distributed platforms: Hadoop & Spark (1 wk)
5. Finding similar items: LSH (2 wks)
6. Clustering (1 wk)
7. Dimensionality reduction (1 wk)

Midterm exam (1 wk)

Part II: Applications of Big Data Analytics (6 wks)
1. Recommender Systems (1 wk)
2. Link Analysis (2 wks)
3. Social Network Graph Mining (2 wks)
4. Others: Large-scale machine learning (1 wk)

Term project presentation (3 wks)
scorePolicy:
Homework assignments and programming exercises: ~40%
Mid-term exam: ~25-30%
Term project and presentation: ~30-35%
materials:
Textbook:
1. Mining of Massive Datasets, Jure Leskovec, Anand Rajaraman, Jeff Ullman, 3rd edition, Cambridge University Press, 2020.

References:
1.  Jiawei Han, Jian Pei, and Hanghang Tong, Data Mining: Concepts and Techniques, 4th edition, Morgan Kaufmann, 2022.
2. Data-Intensive Text Processing with MapReduce, Jimmy Lin and Chris Dyer.
Morgan & Claypool Publishers, 2010.
3. Recent academic papers, tutorials, and slides.
